prompt: Examine how accounting practices support environmental, social, and governance (ESG) disclosures in business reporting.

criteria.name: Understanding of ESG and Sustainability Concepts
criteria.description: Demonstrates understanding of ESG components and sustainability accounting frameworks.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Clearly explains ESG components and links them to accounting practices.
performance_descriptors.good: Describes ESG dimensions with some connection to accounting.
performance_descriptors.average: Mentions ESG concepts with limited detail.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Basic understanding of ESG; unclear connection to accounting.
performance_descriptors.poor: Fails to explain ESG or its relevance to accounting.

criteria.name: Application of Reporting Standards and Frameworks
criteria.description: Applies standards such as GRI or integrated reporting principles.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Effectively applies multiple reporting frameworks like GRI or TCFD.
performance_descriptors.good: Applies at least one ESG reporting standard appropriately.
performance_descriptors.average: Mentions frameworks with limited detail or understanding.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Minimal or incorrect reference to frameworks.

criteria.name: Analysis of ESG Accounting Practices
criteria.description: Analyzes the role of accounting in tracking, reporting, and improving ESG performance.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Insightfully analyzes how accounting measures and communicates ESG performance.
performance_descriptors.good: Explains how ESG performance is reported through accounting.
performance_descriptors.average: Touches on ESG tracking with little analytical depth.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Limited analysis of accounting's role in ESG.
performance_descriptors.poor: No meaningful discussion of ESG accounting practices.

criteria.name: Impact on Stakeholders and Decision-Making
criteria.description: Evaluates how ESG disclosures influence investor decisions and corporate image.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Clearly explains how high-quality ESG disclosures affect stakeholder trust and decisions.
performance_descriptors.good: Explains ESG influence with minor gaps in clarity.
performance_descriptors.average: Mentions investor reaction to ESG reporting with limited support.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Minimal or unclear explanation of ESG impact.
performance_descriptors.poor: No discussion of ESGâ€™s stakeholder relevance.

criteria.name: Structure and Academic Style
criteria.description: Presents content in a formal academic style with logical flow and evidence.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Highly structured, formal, well-supported essay throughout.
performance_descriptors.good: Mostly formal and logical with minor issues in coherence.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Unclear flow or inconsistent academic tone.

key_points: Define ESG and explain how each component relates to business sustainability.
Describe the role of accounting in preparing integrated and sustainability reports.
Discuss how carbon and environmental costs are tracked and reported.
Apply GRI or similar frameworks to ESG data reporting.
Evaluate how ESG transparency impacts investor trust and long-term value creation.
llm_questions: What does ESG stand for and how does it relate to corporate sustainability?
How does accounting contribute to preparing integrated reports or sustainability disclosures?
What is the Global Reporting Initiative (GRI) and how is it used in ESG reporting?
How are environmental and carbon costs tracked in accounting systems?
What is triple bottom line accounting and how is it different from traditional financial reporting?
How do investors respond to companies with strong ESG disclosure practices?
Can you provide examples of companies that use accounting to report ESG performance?
